result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan William Asmus

defendant.name: Asmus, Ryan William
defendant.address: 505 W 8th Street, Grace Place, New Richmond, WI 54017

records.addlTxt:
AMENDED 

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to be fitted with a GPS monitoring device. Can not be within 1/2 mile of  Hilltop Drive in Houlton.  Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 
If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, K. Elert and G. Elert. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

3:00 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Michael Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Scott Selmer appeared by video for Ryan William Asmus, Defendant Ryan William Asmus in court, in custody. INCLUDES 22CF269 (Set for PLEAS) and 22CF710. Atty. Selmer states that there was an agreement. ADA Becker states that the agreement needs to be revisited, requests additional STC. Court notes Motion to Modify Bond filed by State and prelim is needed on 22CF710. ADA Becker states that DE was unable to Grace Place. Atty. Selmer responds, notes Grace Place has 30-day limitation. ADA Becker requests bond modification regarding Grace Place condition. Court modifies bond. Atty. Selmer makes bond argument. ADA Becker responds. Court sets PH on 22CF710 and STC on 22CF269. Adjourned: 3:17 PM. kma

11:34 AM CO: Vlack by phone, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ryan William Asmus in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Selmer in court for Ryan William Asmus. Atty Selmer updates the Court and states DE will need to complete application for Grace Place. Atty Selmer states DE may be able to walk in to Salvation Army in Eau Claire and Minneapolis and he'd be taken in, but doesn't know about how DE would get there. ADA Damrau states there's no where confirmed for DE to go and requests written verification from Grace Place that a bed is available before amending the bond administratively. Atty Selmer will call Salvation Army to see if there's an immediate bed available. Court will amend bond to signature bond once verification is received. Court is available by phone this afternoon if needed. Adjourned at 11:40 AM.  gll
for a continuance of the 9/8/22 BBH. Filed by Atty Scott Selmer. Per EFV on 9-8-2022 : "Okay to move hearing to 11:30" JA will let everyone know of the time change.  mw

01:16 PM   CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Scott Selmer in court for Ryan William Asmus. Defendant Ryan William Asmus in court, in custody. Court reviews case. Atty Selmer states WOPH. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Atty Selmer makes bond argument. ADA Damrau has no objection with conditions. Court denies bond modification at this time. Court needs know where DE will be staying and to hear from Agent. Court sets ARGN and will hear bond. Adjourned 01:33 PM
Arraignment scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: 11:48 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Michelle P Brekken, DF ATTY: Scott Selmer, DF: Ryan William Asmus appeared from jail. Court reviews case. Atty Selmer states DE would like to appeal the competency findings. ADA Brekken objects to Court overturning competency. Atty Selmer has attempted to contact probation agent but not DHS but would try and contact DHS. Court Services advised Court PO Hold was released on 06/05/22. Court reviews statue stating the Department to determain where DE should be transported and Department to determain if DE has gained competency. ADA Brekken notes step father is present and waiting a bed for DE. Atty Selmer to speak with DHS re: DE wishes. Adjourned 12:00 PM
Status conference on June 7, 2022 at 11:45 am.

Court states probation hold is separate from competency issue, as case is suspended including bond. Off record- attys schedule STC with clerk.
